column4: What's the default system-password for su after a clean installation? Is it impossible to access su because I chose to use sudo?
Then something must have gone wrong, because that doesn't work.
what doesn't work exactly?  And *how* is it not working exactly?
Password for default user just doesn't work for su.
Is there any easy way of giving my terminal a black background? I looked in .bashrc, but don't think the background is set in that file.
Great. White on black. That's the one. :->
did you read what ubottu said?  There is no root password.  You can't su to root.  Use sudo instead
Right. That's what I asked. Thought I might could have both though.
there's really no point.  You can do everything with sudo.  If you really think you need a root prompt, just run 'sudo -i', it's the same as 'su -'
Great! Thanks. Well, sometimes when I have to do a lot of stuff using root, it's nicer to not have to type sudo all the time. That's why.
